newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine avg power rates to rise by 3.19 centavo.
newsitem.headline: Philippine avg power rates to rise by 3.19 centavo.

text.p: The Philippine National Power Corp (Napocor) said on Thursday it will raise power rates by an average of 3.19 centavos per kilowatt-hour (kwh) nationwide next month due to the increase in fuel oil and diesel prices.
The Energy Regulatory Board raised the price of fuel oil effective today by 39.5 centavos and diesel oil by 50 centavos as part of a monthly automatic oil price adjustment formula.
Bulk of power generated by Napocor are from fuel oil-fired and diesel-based plants.
Napocor said the adjustments will be reflected in December due to Napocor's one-month inventory of fuel oil and diesel bought on old prices.
